package.name: example/app
package.documentation-string: This is docstring for the example/app package. The package contains a function which does it's job by applying transformation to the first and second arguments: foo When you mention a function like that, it is included into the package description and removed from the "Other functions..." section

function-definition.name: foo
function-definition.documentation-string: This is example function. Just a first argument. Optional keyword argument. Default is 100500. A string with first and other concatenated. Internally it calls example/utils:do-the-job to do the real job. Note, that the link above is broken, but Coo does not warn us when building the docs. Sphinx issues a warning inn such case.

package.name: example/class
package.documentation-string: This package demonstrates how ATDOC displays classes and generic functions. The key consept is user class: user It is possible to check if user has admin privileges, using this function: is-admin Right now, is-admin returns t only for objects of admin: admin

class-definition.name: user
class-definition.documentation-string: All users in the system have this class. Last login slot is updated automatically.NOTE: "Documented Subclasses" section contains only classes which are:

function-definition.name: is-admin
function-definition.documentation-string: Returns t if user can modify the system.

class-definition.name: inner-documented-user
class-definition.documentation-string: This class only to demostrate how ATDOC's docstring collection ignores not exported classes even when they have documentation. Also, it will not be shown in the "Documented Subclasses".Seems, "documented" in terms of ATDOC is "exported" and being the public API.

package.name: example/utils
package.documentation-string: The utils package.This package's docstring is not mention any functions via aboutfun or aboutclass tags.Hence, the only exported function do-the-job will be show in a separate section "Other functions in example/utils".

function-definition.name: do-the-job
function-definition.documentation-string: The function does the job.It concatenates first and second arguments calling internal function concat. On this multiline we'll check how does documentationsystem processes docstrings.

function-definition.name: concat
function-definition.documentation-string: This function is not exported and should not be showed in the API reference.
